tit.e: Maesaka Pass (a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City)
Maesaka Pass (a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 前坂（まえさか）は京都府京都市北区 (京都市)にある峠である。
sen.e: Maesaka Pass is a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Maesaka Pass is a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Maesaka Pass is a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 標高363mの京都府道31号西陣杉坂線上に位置する峠である。
sen.e: It is located on Kyoto Prefecture Road 31, Nishijin-Sugisaka Route at an altitude of 363 meters.
It is the pass located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 31 Nishijin-Sugisaka Line at an altitude of 363 meters.
It is the pass located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 31 Nishijin-Sugisaka Line at an altitude of 363 meters.

sen.j: 京都市北区鷹峯船水と同区西賀茂鑓磨岩を隔てている。
sen.e: It is on the border between Takagamine Funamizu and Nishigamo Yaritogiiwa in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
It separates Takagamine-funamizu, Kita Ward, Kyoto City and Nishigamo-yaritogiiwa in the same ward.
It separates Takagamine-funamizu, Kita Ward, Kyoto City and Nishigamo-yaritogiiwa in the same ward.

sen.j: 別名として前坂峠（まえさかとうげ）や京見前坂（きょうみまえさか）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Maesakatoge or Kyomimaesaka.
It is also called Maesaka-toge or Kyomi-maesaka.
It is also called Maesaka-toge or Kyomi-maesaka.

sen.j: 同じ街道上に隣接して京見峠があり、上洛する際には最後の難関である京見峠の前の坂ということで、この前坂という名がついたという伝承がある。
sen.e: According to lore, its name is derived from the fact that in going to Kyoto, one faces Kyomi Pass, the last difficulty right in front of which Maesaka Pass is there on the same road. (The latter pass is "Mae no saka" in Japanese.)

Kyomi-toge Pass is adjacent in the same road and a lore says Maesaka Pass (literally, previous pass) was named after the fact that it is located just before Kyomi-toge Pass, the last chokepoint to Kyoto.

Kyomi-toge Pass is adjacent in the same road and a lore says Maesaka Pass (literally, previous pass) was named after the fact that it is located just before Kyomi-toge Pass, the last chokepoint to Kyoto.

sen.j: 京見峠と繋がりの深い峠である。
sen.e: Maesaka Pass is closely-linked to Kyomi Pass.
Maesaka Pass is closely-linked to Kyomi-toge Pass.
Maesaka Pass is closely-linked to Kyomi-toge Pass.

sen.j: 車両での通行が可能な峠である。
sen.e: It is travelable by car.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.

sen.j: アスファルトで舗装されてこそいるが、急勾配でなおかつ狭路な区間が連続する峠道である。
sen.e: Although the road over the mountain pass is paved with asphalt, many road sections are steep and narrow.
Although it is paved with asphalt, the road of the pass has sharp slopes and series of narrow section.
Although it is paved with asphalt, the road of the pass has sharp slopes and series of narrow section.

sen.j: 急カーブが連続する区間もあり、古くから在る道の線形を残している。
sen.e: Some sections are sharply curved and keep old-time road alignments.
It has series of tight curves and keeps old-time road alignments.
It has series of tight curves and keeps old-time road alignments.

sen.j: 標高はそこそこ高いが、峠附近に住宅があるので狭路の割りに交通量は多い。
sen.e: The pass is relatively high and its road is narrow, but since there are houses near the pass, traffic is heavy on its road.
The altitude is a little high and the traffic is heavy for houses nearby though it is a narrow road.
The altitude is a little high and the traffic is heavy for houses nearby although it is a narrow road.

sen.j: またサイクリングコースの一つとなっている為、自転車の交通量も多い峠である。
sen.e: There are many bicycles on the road because it is one of the cycling courses.
There are many bicycles in the pass because it is one of the cycling courses.
There are many bicycles in the pass because it is one of the cycling courses.
